element.key:
If you require an encrypted credential in your configuration , then you can enter it on the App's setup page

Then in your configration below refer to it in the format {encrypted:somekey}

element.name: activation_key
element.label: Activation Key
element.key: Visit http://www.baboonbones.com/#activation to obtain a non-expiring key

element.name: log_level
element.label: Log Level
element.key: Modular Input script python logging level for messages written to $SPLUNK_HOME/var/log/splunk/commandmodinput_app_modularinput.log , defaults to 'INFO'

element.name: command_name
element.label: Command Name
element.key: Name of the system command if on the PATH (ps), or if not , the full path to the command (/bin/ps).Environment variables in the format $VARIABLE$ can be included and they will be substituted ie: $SPLUNK_HOME$

element.name: command_args
element.label: Command Arguments
element.key: Arguments string for the command.Environment variables in the format $VARIABLE$ can be included and they will be substituted ie: $SPLUNK_HOME$

element.name: streaming_output
element.label: Streaming Output ?
element.key: Whether or not the command output is streaming(std out remains open) or not(results received and std out is closed).If it is streaming then "Execution Interval" won't really be relevant.

element.name: execution_interval
element.label: Command Execution Interval
element.key: Interval time in seconds to execute the command, defaults to 60 seconds

element.name: output_handler
element.label: Command Output Handler
element.key: Python classname of custom command output handler,defaults to DefaultCommandOutputHandler

element.name: output_handler_args
element.label: Command Output Handler Arguments
element.key: Command output handler arguments string , key=value,key2=value2
